page.title: 16FARMING - DEER
page.content: The sports rifles weigh 12-14lbs and a telescope is used by the keeper as it magnifies 50 times rather than binoculars which are weaker. The shot stags are cleaned out for the wild animals and birds. They are dragged out by hand and put on ponies with the antlers pointing along the ponies' backs on special saddles. Sometimes they transport the deer home by boat. 15th-20th September is the first coat of snow on the hills. November. In November the keeper shoots the poorer hinds of 8-9 stone in weight. It is too risky to take ponies in snowy weather so snow machines and the Argo cats are used. Each year 80 stags and 40 hinds are shot. This estate makes a big financial loss each year but is used as a tax loss to balance other business interests.
